channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14964] Backport HBASE-14901 to brach-1 - There is duplicated code to create/manage encryption keys
item.description:
There is duplicated code from MobUtils.createEncryptionContext in HStore, and there is a subset of that code in HFileReaderImpl.

Refactored key selection
Moved both to EncryptionUtil.java
Can't figure out how to write a unit test for this, but there's no new code just refactoring.

A lot of the Mob stuff hasn't been backported, so this is a very small patch.
item.summary: Backport HBASE-14901 to brach-1 - There is duplicated code to create/manage encryption keys

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: started a manual precommit test run: https://builds.apache.org/view/PreCommit%20Builds/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16876/
now that I look closer, that test run is almost certainly going to fail. aborting it.

Thanks for working on this Nate. The way our precommit tester works, all patches default to working against the master branch. For fixing something specific to an earlier branch, like this, you should name the patch HBASE-XXXX-${branch}.Y.patch

I'm re-uploading your patch, with the target branch noted. I also took the chance to update the commit message to note this jira, and to include a summary of what the original change being backported is.

+1 overall.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/16877//testReport/

it looks like the unit tests didn't fire, so I'm going to see if I can figure out why before moving this out of patch available.
okay, rerunning so that tests will run this time.
Thanks for fixing my patch name and kicking off the tests, Sean Busbey]! I'll wait for the tests to come back, and assuming those are clean, clean up the imports to fix the checkstyle.
re-uploading to correct name again, since that last one gets parsed as "branch-1.1" :/

+1 overall.
